Summary My professional career began as a Nuclear Electrician's Mate in the US Navy. After 6 years in the Navy I moved to the Sacramento, CA area and attended Sacramento City College before transferring to University of California, Davis where I graduated with a Bachelor's of Science in Computer Engineering and a minor in Technology Management. After graduation I spent some time abroad in Europe before gaining my current position as a Software Validation Engineer with Intel Corporation. 
 
My specialties include: 
Linux kernel development 
Windows Hardware Quality Labs (WHQL) certification

Experience Product Development Engineer Intel Corporation 2011  –  2014  (3 years) Kulim, Kedah, Malaysia + Responsible for development, release and maintenance of test programs intended for automated system-level testing of low-power Intel CPU by working closely with an Agile team of test and content developers. 
+ Drive continuous improvement of manufacturing productivity indicators such as quality (DPM), yield, test time, and retest rate by utilizing established processes and methodologies such as LEAN. 
+ Factory engineering controls team lead responsible for overseeing the integrity of high value inventory (HVI). 
+ Team lead responsible for supervising 2 junior engineers and 1 technician. 
 
Key Achievements: 
+ Released critical system-level test program to enable the pilot and shipment of Intel’s first Smartphone CPU. 
+ Enabled the pilot of Intel’s first Tablet CPU within a record 2 weeks’ time by working closely with cross-geo firmware team and enabling 24x7 remote debugging to resolve critical firmware issue. 
+ Led a factory wide clean-up of engineering HVI that resulted in 40% reduction in non-compliance inventory. System Validation Engineer Intel Corporation 2011  –  2011  (less than a year) Kulim, Kedah, Malaysia + System testing of Intel Solid State Drives (SSDs), including test plan definition and maintenance, infrastructure setup (servers/desktops/network), and test script debug and fix. 
+ Developed and maintained test scripts for in-house test automation system using in-house developed scripting language and Python. 
+ Worked with developers to test and deploy new test automation system functions. 
+ Wrote and maintained online user and operational documentation describing test scripts and test infrastructure setup procedures. 
 
Key Achievements: 
+ Set up lab and test infrastructure for SSD system testing in a new start-up site in Malaysia. 
+ Deployed test scripts used for the automated testing of Intel’s 3rd generation SATA SSD. Embedded Software Validation Engineer Intel Corporation 2010  –  2011  (1 year) Bayan Lepas, Penang, Malaysia + Systems and acceptance testing of embedded subsystems Linux drivers and DRM technologies, including reviewing requirements documents, test planning, design, implementation, execution, reporting, and defect management. Also, participated in various other software development and test life cycle activities. 
+ Worked with developers in an Agile environment to debug and address software defects. 
+ Team lead responsible for mentoring 2 junior software validation engineers. 
 
Key Achievements: 
+ Ported test code from legacy to new test automation system using C language and Python scripts. Also, coded and maintained Linux test programs for security APIs testing on Intel embedded platform. 
+ Implemented risk-based test strategy that used structured methods to prioritize and categorize test cases and identify high risk features, resulting in reduced test execution time and yet maintaining good software quality. 
+ First certified department peer review moderator responsible for moderating software deliverable reviews. Software Validation Engineer Intel Corporation 2004  –  2010  (6 years) Kulim, Kedah, Malaysia + Researched and evaluated Intel PC motherboard (MB) subsystem technologies, e.g. audio, and LAN. 
+ Reviewed requirements and influenced design for software drivers and applications.  
+ Functional, integration, systems and acceptance testing of MB subsystems’ software drivers and applications, including test planning, design, implementation, execution, and reporting. 
+ Debugged, diagnosed, and managed software issues by working closely with internal and external teams. 
+ Created and maintained end user and operational documentations. 
+ Managed lab operations for software validation team. 
 
Key Achievements: 
+ Tested software drivers and applications for 6 generations of desktop and 2 generations of mobile products. Ensured zero high or critical priority issues before product launch. 
+ In 2004, resolved VMWare software issue, resulting in 8K customer design win and USD56K cost saving. 
+ In 2008, created PC audio documentation that helped reduce >30% of audio issues reported by end users to Intel customer support group.  
+ In 2009, contributed to the enabling of Win7 support on Intel desktop products by working with multiple audio and LAN software vendors to ensure Win7 compliant drivers are tested and delivered on schedule. 
+ Led the planning and implementation of software lab’s outsourcing model, resulting in increased flexibility, scalability, and efficiency of lab operations. Also, expanded the team from a 10-person to 16-person team.
